subtitle: Chapter four now I understand what
Christ meant when he said you have heard
that has been said an eye for an eye and
a tooth for a tooth and I say to you do
not resist evil Christ means you've been
taught to consider it right and rational
protect yourself against evil by
violence to pluck out an eye for an eye
to institute courts of law for the
puzzle of criminals and have a police
and an army to defend you against the
attacks of an enemy but I say to you do
no violence to any man take no part in
violence never do evil to any man not
even to those whom you call your enemies
I now understand that in this doctrine
of non-resistance Christ not only tells
us what the natural result of following
his doctrine will be but by placing the
same doctrine in opposition to the
Mosaic law the Roman law and the various
cause of the present time he clearly
shows that it ought to be the basis of
our social existence and she delivers
from the evil we have brought on
ourselves he says you think to amend
evil by your laws but they only
aggravate it there is only one way by
which you can put a stop to evil it is
by indiscriminately returning good for
evil you have tried the other law for
thousands of year now try mine which is
a very reverse strange to say I have had
frequent opportunities lately of
conversion with men of diverse opinions
on this doctrine of non-resistance I
have met with some who agreed with me
though these have been few but there are
two orders of men who always refused to
admit even in principle a direct
understanding of this doctrine and
warmly uphold the Justice of persistent
evil they are men belonging to two
extreme poles are Christian conservative
Patriots who consider their church as a
true Orthodox one and our revolutionary
atheists neither the former no the
latter will give up their right to
resist by violence what they consider is
evil even their clearest most learned
men close their eyes to the simple
self-evident truth that if we admit the
right of one man to resist what he
considers as evil by violence we cannot
refuse another the right to resist by
violence what he in turn may consider is
evil a short time ago I met with a
correspondent particularly instructive
as bearing on this very point it was
carried on between an Orthodox Slava
fill and a Christian revolutionist
the former excuse the violence of war in
the name of all is oppressed slovenia
brethren and the latter have indicated
the violence of the revolution in the
name of his oppressed brethren the
russian peasants both admit the
necessity for violence in both ground
their reasoning on the doctrine of
christ each of us gives the doctrine of
Christ as interpretation of his own but
it is never the direct and simple one
that flows out of his words we have
grounded the conduct of our lives on the
principle that he rejects we do not
choose to understand his teaching in the
simple and direct a sense those who call
themselves believers believe that Christ
got the second person of the Trinity
made himself man in order to set us an
example how to live and they strictly
fulfil the most complicated duties such
as preparing for the sacraments building
churches sending out missionaries naming
pastors for parochial administration etc
they forget one trifling circumstance to
do as he tells them unbelievers on the
other hand tried to regulate their lives
somehow or another but not in according
to the law of Christ feeling convinced
beforehand that it is worthless
nobody ever tries to fulfill his
teaching nor is that all instead of
making an effort to follow his
Commandments both believers and
unbelievers decide beforehand that to do
so is impossible Christ said the law of
resistance by violence which you have
made the basis of your lives is
unnatural and wrong and he gives us
instead the law of non-resistance which
he tells us can alone deliver us from
evil he says you think to eradicate evil
by your human laws of violence they only
increase it during thousands and
thousands of years you have tried to
annihilate evil by evil and you have not
annihilated it you have but increased it
follow the teach and I give you by word
in deed and you approve it's practical
power not only does he speak this but he
also remains true to his own doctrine
not to resist evil and his life and in
his death believers take all this in
with their ears and hear it and read it
in churches calling it the Word of God
they call him God and then they say his
doctrine is sublime but the organization
of our lives render its observance
impossible it would change the whole
course of our lives to do which we are
so used to which we are so satisfied
therefore we believe in this doctrine
only as an ideal that
kind must drive after an ideal that is
to be attained by prayer by believing in
the sacraments and redemption and in the
resurrection of the Dead others
unbelievers the free interpreters of
Christ's doctrine the historians of a
religion
Strauss Renan and others adopting the
interpretation of the church that this
doctrine has no direct application to
life and is only an ideal teaching that
can only serve to console the
weak-minded say very seriously that the
doctrine of Christ was all very well for
the savage population of the deserts of
Galilee but that we with our
civilization can only consider it as a
lovely reverie as Renan calls him
according to their opinion Christ could
not attain the height of understanding
all the wisdom of our civilization
refinement if he had stood on the same
scale of civilization as he's learned
men he would not have uttered these
pretty trifles about the birds of the
air about letting one's cheek be struck
and about taking no care for tomorrow
learning historians judge Christianity
according to what they see in our
Christian society now the Christian
society of our times considers our lives
as a good and holy one with its
institutions of solitary imprisonment of
fortresses sweatshops journals brothels
and Parliament while it only borrows
from the doctrine of Christ what is not
against these habits of life and as
Christ's teaching is in direct
opposition to all this nothing is taken
from that teaching but its mere words to
learn of the story and see this and not
having the same interest in conceding
the fact as the so called believers have
they subject this for them meaningless
doctrine of Christ to profound analysis
argue against it and prove on good
grounds that Christianity never was
anything but the dream of an idealist
and yet it seems to me that before
pronouncing an opinion upon the doctrine
of Christ we ought clearly to understand
what it is and in order to decide
whether his teaching is rational or not
it is necessary first of all to believe
that he meant exactly what he said this
is just what neither the interpreters of
the church nor free thinkers do and the
reason why is not hard to see we know
very well the teaching of Christ as we
have received it embraces all of the
errors into which humanity has fallen
all of vanity empty idols the existence
of which we try to justify by calling
them church government
culture science arts and civilization
thinking thus to exclude them from our
rank of errors but Christ warns us
against them all without excluding any
Touhou not only Christ's words but those
are all Hebrew prophets of John the
Baptist and of all the truly wise men
who have ever lived have referred to the
same church the same government culture
civilization etc calling them evils on
the cause of man's perdition for
instance suppose an architect were to
say to the owner of a house your house
is in a bad state
it must be wholly rebuilt and where they
didn't go on giving all the necessary
details of what the kind of beams would
be required how they were to cut and
replaced if the owner would return in
deaf ear to the architects word about
the ruinous condition of his house and
the necessity for its being rebuilt and
we're only to listen was a feigned
interest to the secondary details
concerning the proposed repairs the
architects councils would evidently
appear but not so much useless talk and
if the owner happened to feel no great
respect for the Builder he would call
his advice foolish this is exactly what
occurs with a teaching of Christ I use a
simile for want of a better one and I
remember that Christ while preaching his
doctrine used one very like it he said I
will destroy your temple on within three
days I will build up another he was
crucified for these words his doctrine
is crucified for the same reason up to
the present time the lease that can be
required of those who judge another
man's teaching is that they should take
the teachers words in the exact sense in
which he used them Christ does not
consider his teaching as some high ideal
of what mankind should be but cannot
attain to nor does he consider it as a
chimerical poetical fancy fit only to
captivate the simple-minded inhabitants
of Galilee he considers his teaching his
work a work that is to save mankind his
suffering on the cross was no dream he
groaned in agony and died for his
teaching and how many people have died
and will still die in the same cause
such teaching cannot be called a dream
every doctrine of truth is a dream for
those who are in error
we have come such a state of error that
there are many among us who say as I did
myself formerly that this doctrine of
Christ is Chai maracle because it is
incompatible with the nature of man
it is incompatible the nature of man
they say to turn the other cheek when he
has been struck it is incompatible with
the nature of man to give up his
property to another to work not for
himself but for others it is natural for
man they say to protect himself his own
safety that of his family in his
property in other words it is the nature
of man to struggle for life learning
lawyers prove scientifically that the
most sacred duty of a man is to protect
his rights that is to struggle we need
only for one moment to cast aside the
idea that the present organization of
our lives is established by man is the
best and most sacred and then the
arguments that the teaching of Christ is
incompatible with human nature
immediately turns against the arguer who
will deny that is repugnant and
harrowing to a man's feeling to torture
kill not only a man but even less a dog
a hand or a calf I have known men living
by agricultural labor who have ceased
entirely to eat meat only because they
had to kill their own cattle and yet our
lives are so organized that for one
individual to obtain any advantage in
life another must suffer which is
against human nature the whole
organization of our lives the
complicated mechanism of our
institutions whose sole object is
violence are but proof of the degree to
which violence is repugnant to human
nature no judge will ever undertake to
strangle his own hands the man who means
contend to death
no magistrate will himself drag of
peasant from his weeping family in order
to shut him up in prison not a single
general not a single soldier would kill
hundreds of Turks and Germans and
devastate their village no not one of
them would consent to wound a single man
were it not in war and in obedience
discipline and the oath of allegiance
cruelty is only exercised thanks to our
complicated social machinery when it can
be so divided among a number that none
shall bear the sole responsibility or
recognize how unnatural all cruelty is
some make laws others apply them others
again drill their fellow-creatures in
the habit of discipline that is of
senseless passive obedience and these
same discipline man in their turn do
violence to others killing without
knowing why or wherefore but let a man
even for a moment shake off and thought
the net of worldly institutions that so
ensnare
and he will see what is really
incompatible with his nature if once we
cease to affirm that the evil we are so
used to and profit by is an immutable
divine truth we may see clearly which is
a more natural to man violence or the
laws of Christ which is better to know
that the comfort and safety of our
family and myself all my joys and
pleasures are obtained at the price of
the misery depravity and suffered a
millions by yearly executions by
hundreds and thousands of suffering
prisoners and millions of soldiers
policemen and sergeants torn from their
homes and half stupefied by military
discipline who protect me and my idle
pleasure by keeping starving men at a
distance with their loaded pistols to
know that every dainty morsel I put into
my mouth or give my children is obtained
at the price of all this suffering which
is inevitable in order to obtain these
dainty's or to know that my affairs my
own that nobody suffers for the want of
it and nobody has suffered in procuring
it for me it is sufficient to comprehend
once and for all that in our present
organization of life every joy in every
moment of peace is bought at the cost of
the privation and suffering of thousands
who are restrained by violence in order
to see clearly what is natural to man
that is not only to the animal nature of
man but to his rational nature as well
it is sufficient understand the doctrine
of Christ in all its high significance
and with all the consequence that
entails to see that it is not
inconsistent with human nature but that
on the contrary his whole doctrine
throws aside what is inconsistent with
human nature the delusive human teaching
of resistance of evil which is a chief
cause of all human mystery the doctrine
of Christ which teaches us not to resist
evil is a dream but the sight of man in
whose breast love and pity are innate
spending their lives in burning their
brethren to stake scourging him breaking
him at the wheel lashing slitting their
nostrils putting them on the rack
keeping them fettered sending them to
the galleys of the gallows shooting them
condemning him to sell art a confinement
imprisoning women and children
organizing the slaughter of tens and
thousands by war bringing about
periodical revolutions and rebellions
the sight of others passively fulfilling
these atrocities the sight of others
again writhing under these tortures or
avenging
this is no dream when once we clearly
understand the teaching of Christ we see
that it's not the world given by God to
man for us happiness that as a dream but
the world such as men have made it their
own destruction that is a wild
terrifying dream the delirium of a
madman a dream from which it is enough
to awake once never to return to it God
came down from heaven the Son of God the
second person of the Holy Trinity and
became man to redeem us from the
punishment entail by the sins of Adam we
think that this God must speak in some
mysterious mystical way difficult to be
understood indeed that his word can only
be understood through faith in God's
grace and yet God's words are so simple
and so clear
he said do no evil to each other and
there will be no evil is it possible
that the revelation of God is so simple
can this be all and this so familiar to
us the prophet Elijah having fled from
the haunts of men and concealed himself
in Iraq had it revealed to him that he
should see God at the entrance of a
cavern a tempest arose the trees were
rent asunder Elijah thought God was
there and looked but God was not there
the earthquake fire issued out of it the
rock was split in two in the mountains
fell Elijah looked but God was not there
then all grew still in calm and the
light breeze wafted the fragrance of the
freshened fields toward him
Elijah looked and God was there it is
thus with the simple words of God do not
resist evil they are very simple but
they contain in themselves the soul and
eternal law of God and man this law is
eternal and if in history we find any
progress made toward the annihilation of
evil it is due to those who truly
understand the doctrine of Christ who
suffered evil without resisting by
violence the progression of mankind
toward good is brought about by
martyrdom not by tyranny fire cannot
extinguish fire no more than evil can
expect great evil good meeting with evil
and remain untainted by it can alone
conquer evil there is a law in the heart
of each man that is immutable as a law
of Galileo still more immutable men may
turn aside from an or conceal from
others nevertheless it is the only path
that leads to true happiness
each step that has brought us near to
the great end was taken in the name of
the doctrine of Christ do not resist
evil it is with great confidence even
then that Galileo that the follower of
Christ can say in defiance of all the
temptations around him and the threats
held out to him it is not by violence
but by doing good that you will
eradicate evil and if the progress is
made slowly it is only because the
clarity simplicity and rationality of
the teaching of Christ and it's
inevitable absolute necessity are
concealed from the eyes of men in the
most crafty and dangerous manner
concealed under a spurious teaching
falsely called his end of chapter
